name: OciContainerInstance
description:
OciContainerInstance is the top-level resource representing an Oracle
 Cloud Infrastructure Container Instance -- OCI's serverless container
 service for running containers without managing compute infrastructure.

fields.name: CompartmentId
fields.description: OCID of the compartment where the container instance will be created.

fields.name: AvailabilityDomain
fields.description:
Availability domain where the container instance runs.
 Example: "Uocm:PHX-AD-1".

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description:
Human-readable name for the container instance shown in the OCI Console.
 Falls back to metadata.name if not provided.

fields.name: Shape
fields.description:
Compute shape for the container instance.
 Example: "CI.Standard.E4.Flex", "CI.Standard.E3.Flex".

fields.name: ShapeConfig
fields.description:
CPU and memory allocation for the entire container instance.
 Individual containers can set resource limits within this envelope.

fields.name: Containers
fields.description:
Containers to run on this instance. At least one container is required.
 Multiple containers share the same network namespace and can communicate
 over localhost.

fields.name: Vnics
fields.description:
Virtual network interface cards providing network connectivity.
 At least one VNIC is required. Each VNIC is attached to a subnet.

fields.name: ContainerRestartPolicy
fields.description:
Restart policy applied to all containers in this instance.
 When omitted, defaults to ALWAYS.

fields.name: FaultDomain
fields.description:
Fault domain within the availability domain.
 When omitted, OCI selects a fault domain automatically.
 Example: "FAULT-DOMAIN-1".

fields.name: GracefulShutdownTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description:
Seconds to wait for containers to gracefully terminate before
 forcefully stopping them. Applies when the instance is stopped or deleted.

fields.name: DnsConfig
fields.description:
DNS resolver configuration for containers. When omitted, containers
 inherit DNS settings from the subnet's DHCP options.

fields.name: ImagePullSecrets
fields.description: Credentials for pulling container images from private registries.

fields.name: Volumes
fields.description:
Volumes accessible to containers via volume mounts. A container
 instance supports up to 32 volumes.

nestedTypes.name: Capabilities
nestedTypes.description: Capabilities controls Linux capability grants and revocations.

fields.name: AddCapabilities
fields.description:
Capabilities to add to the container process.
 Example: ["NET_ADMIN", "SYS_TIME"]

fields.name: DropCapabilities
fields.description:
Capabilities to drop from the container process.
 Example: ["ALL"]

nestedTypes.name: Container
nestedTypes.description: Container defines a single container running within the instance.

fields.name: ImageUrl
fields.description:
Container image URL.
 Example: "docker.io/library/nginx:latest", "ghcr.io/org/app:v1.2".
 Default registry is docker.io/library if not specified.

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description: Human-readable name for the container.

fields.name: Command
fields.description: Overrides the image's ENTRYPOINT. Each element is a separate argument.

fields.name: Arguments
fields.description:
Arguments passed to the ENTRYPOINT process.
 Total size of all arguments combined must be <= 64 KB.

fields.name: EnvironmentVariables
fields.description:
Environment variables injected into the container.
 Total size of all names + values combined must be <= 64 KB.

fields.name: WorkingDirectory
fields.description: Working directory for the container's entrypoint process.

fields.name: IsResourcePrincipalDisabled
fields.description:
When true, disables OCI resource principal access for this container.
 Resource principal (v2.2) is enabled by default.

fields.name: ResourceConfig
fields.description:
CPU and memory limits for this container. When omitted, the container
 can use all resources available to the instance.

fields.name: HealthChecks
fields.description:
Health checks for monitoring container readiness. Supports HTTP and
 TCP probe types with configurable thresholds and intervals.

fields.name: SecurityContext
fields.description: Linux security settings for the container process.

fields.name: VolumeMounts
fields.description: Volumes to mount into this container's filesystem.

nestedTypes.name: ContainerResourceConfig
nestedTypes.description:
ContainerResourceConfig sets CPU and memory limits for an individual
 container. These limits are within the instance-level ShapeConfig envelope.

fields.name: MemoryLimitInGbs
fields.description:
Maximum memory in gigabytes the container can consume.
 When omitted, the container can use all available instance memory.

fields.name: VcpusLimit
fields.description:
Maximum logical CPUs the container can consume.
 1 OCPU = 2 logical CPUs. Values can be fractional (e.g., 0.5).
 When omitted, the container can use all available instance CPUs.

nestedTypes.name: DnsConfig
nestedTypes.description: DnsConfig customizes DNS resolution for containers.

fields.name: Nameservers
fields.description:
IP addresses of DNS name servers (IPv4 or IPv6).
 When omitted, uses nameservers from the subnet's DHCP options.

fields.name: Options
fields.description:
Resolver options in resolv.conf format.
 Example: ["ndots:5", "edns0"]

fields.name: Searches
fields.description:
Search domains for unqualified hostname lookups.
 When omitted, uses searches from the subnet's DHCP options.

nestedTypes.name: HealthCheck
nestedTypes.description: HealthCheck defines a probe for monitoring container health.

fields.name: HealthCheckType
fields.description: Protocol for the health check.

fields.name: Port
fields.description: Port to probe.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Optional name for the health check, unique within the container instance.

fields.name: Path
fields.description:
URL path for HTTP health checks. Required when health_check_type is http.
 Example: "/healthz".

fields.name: FailureAction
fields.description:
Action to take when the health check fails.
 When omitted, defaults to KILL.

fields.name: FailureThreshold
fields.description: Consecutive failures required to consider the container unhealthy.

fields.name: SuccessThreshold
fields.description: Consecutive successes required to consider the container healthy again.

fields.name: InitialDelayInSeconds
fields.description: Seconds to wait after container start before running the first check.

fields.name: IntervalInSeconds
fields.description: Seconds between consecutive health checks.

fields.name: TimeoutInSeconds
fields.description: Seconds to wait for a health check response before considering it failed.

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Custom HTTP headers sent with HTTP health checks.

nestedTypes.name: HealthCheckHeader
nestedTypes.description: HealthCheckHeader is a key/value HTTP header sent with health check probes.

nestedTypes.name: ImagePullSecret
nestedTypes.description:
ImagePullSecret provides credentials for pulling container images
 from private registries.

fields.name: RegistryEndpoint
fields.description:
Registry endpoint URL.
 Example: "ghcr.io", "docker.io", "us-ashburn-1.ocir.io".

fields.name: SecretType
fields.description: Authentication method for the registry.

fields.name: Username
fields.description:
Username for basic authentication. Required when secret_type is basic.
 Must be base64-encoded.

fields.name: Password
fields.description:
Password for basic authentication. Required when secret_type is basic.
 Must be base64-encoded.

fields.name: SecretId
fields.description:
OCID of an OCI Vault secret containing registry credentials.
 Required when secret_type is vault.

nestedTypes.name: SecurityContext
nestedTypes.description:
SecurityContext configures Linux security settings for a container.
 The security context type is always LINUX (hardcoded by IaC modules).

fields.name: IsNonRootUserCheckEnabled
fields.description:
When true, validates at runtime that the container does not run as
 UID 0. Fails the container start if the image runs as root.

fields.name: IsRootFileSystemReadonly
fields.description: When true, the container's root filesystem is mounted read-only.

fields.name: RunAsUser
fields.description:
User ID (UID) for the container's entrypoint process.
 Defaults to the UID specified in the container image.

fields.name: RunAsGroup
fields.description:
Group ID (GID) for the container's entrypoint process.
 When specified, run_as_user should also be provided.

fields.name: Capabilities
fields.description: Linux capabilities to add or drop from the container process.

nestedTypes.name: ShapeConfig
nestedTypes.description:
ShapeConfig specifies CPU and memory for the container instance.
 Container Instance shapes are always flex, so both fields are meaningful.

fields.name: Ocpus
fields.description:
Number of OCPUs allocated to the container instance.
 Example: 1.0, 2.0, 4.0.

fields.name: MemoryInGbs
fields.description:
Memory in gigabytes. When omitted, OCI assigns a default based
 on the OCPU count (typically 1 GB per OCPU minimum).

nestedTypes.name: Vnic
nestedTypes.description:
Vnic defines a virtual network interface card attached to the container
 instance. All containers share the instance's VNICs.

fields.name: SubnetId
fields.description: OCID of the subnet in which to create the VNIC.

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description: Human-readable name for the VNIC.

fields.name: HostnameLabel
fields.description: Hostname label for the VNIC's primary private IP in subnet DNS.

fields.name: IsPublicIpAssigned
fields.description:
Whether to assign a public IP to the VNIC.
 When omitted, uses the subnet's default public IP assignment setting.

fields.name: NsgIds
fields.description: OCIDs of network security groups to add this VNIC to.

fields.name: PrivateIp
fields.description:
Static private IP address within the subnet's CIDR.
 When omitted, OCI assigns one automatically.

fields.name: SkipSourceDestCheck
fields.description:
When true, disables source/destination checking on the VNIC.
 Required for NAT instances or virtual routers.

nestedTypes.name: Volume
nestedTypes.description:
Volume defines a shared storage volume accessible to containers via
 volume mounts.

fields.name: Name
fields.description:
Unique name for this volume within the container instance.
 Containers reference this name in their volume_mounts.

fields.name: VolumeType
fields.description: Storage backing for the volume.

fields.name: BackingStore
fields.description:
Backing store for emptydir volumes. Options: "EPHEMERAL_STORAGE"
 (disk-backed) or "MEMORY" (tmpfs). Only applicable when volume_type
 is emptydir.

fields.name: Configs
fields.description:
Config file entries for configfile volumes. Each entry becomes a file
 in the volume. Only applicable when volume_type is configfile.

nestedTypes.name: VolumeConfig
nestedTypes.description: VolumeConfig defines a single file within a configfile volume.

fields.name: Data
fields.description: Base64-encoded contents of the file. Decoded to plain text at mount time.

fields.name: FileName
fields.description: Name of the file within the volume. Must be unique across the volume.

fields.name: Path
fields.description:
Optional relative path within the volume mount directory.
 When omitted, the file is placed at the volume mount root.

nestedTypes.name: VolumeMount
nestedTypes.description: VolumeMount attaches a named volume to a path in the container's filesystem.

fields.name: MountPath
fields.description:
Path inside the container where the volume is mounted.
 Example: "/data", "/etc/config".

fields.name: VolumeName
fields.description:
Name of the volume to mount. Must match a volume defined in the
 instance-level volumes list.

fields.name: IsReadOnly
fields.description: When true, the volume is mounted read-only.

fields.name: Partition
fields.description: If the volume has partitions, the partition number to mount.

fields.name: SubPath
fields.description: Sub-path within the volume to mount instead of the volume root.
